intro: Stephania tetrandra var. glabra, commonly known as Chinese skullcap, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers and distinctive, fleshy, yellow berries. Its roots are the primary part used in traditional medicine for their pharmacological properties. The botanical features of this plant make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
